description:
Your task is to create a Python class named Task that will represent a single task in our task management system. The class should include the following attributes:

  • title: The title of the task (string).
  • description: A brief description of the task (string).
  • priority: The priority level of the task (string).
  • deadline: The deadline for the task (string).
  • completed: A boolean indicating whether the task is completed (default: False).

Additionally, implement the following methods:

  • mark_as_complete(): Sets the completed attribute to True.
  • display(): Prints the details of the task.
code_stub:
class Task:
    def __init__(self, title, description, priority, deadline):
        # Initialize attributes here
        pass

    def mark_as_complete(self):
        # Mark the task as complete
        pass

    def display(self):
        # Display task details
        pass
correct_code:
class Task:
    def __init__(self, title, description, priority, deadline):
        self.title = title
        self.description = description
        self.priority = priority
        self.deadline = deadline
        self.completed = False

    def mark_as_complete(self):
        self.completed = True

    def display(self):
        print(f"Title: {self.title}")
        print(f"Description: {self.description}")
        print(f"Priority: {self.priority}")
        print(f"Deadline: {self.deadline}")
        print(f"Completed: {self.completed}")
expected_output:
Title: Example Task
Description: This is a sample description.
Priority: High
Deadline: 2024-12-31
Completed: False
